thread.title: Anderson fights through loss, leads Sam Houston over Brack
thread.title_full: Anderson fights through loss, leads Sam Houston over Brack

author: Associated Press
title: Anderson fights through loss, leads Sam Houston over Brack
text:
Anderson fights through loss, leads Sam Houston over Brack Associated Press Published 11:48 pm, Thursday, October 1, 2015 
Jawon Anderson was sitting in a church on G Street when his phone started ringing Thursday night. 
People sitting in the stands at Alamo Stadium kept calling the Sam Houston junior wide receiver while his teammates were clinging to a lead over Brackenridge in a District 28-5A game, so Anderson carried his grief across town to the stadium hanging over Highway 281. 
His first catch ended up being the longest touchdown of his career. 
Six days after one of his best friends was shot and killed, Anderson helped the Hurricanes remain undefeated with two touchdowns in a 32-14 win over the Eagles, including a 99-yard scoring reception in the third quarter. 
For more, visit ExpressNews.com.
